verses.verse: And it came to pass in those days <S%H3117><s%>, when there was no king <S%H4428><s%> in Israel <S%H3478><s%>, that there was a certain <S%H376><s%> Levite <S%H3881><s%> sojourning <S%H1481><s%> on the side <S%H3411><s%> of mountain <S%H2022><s%> Ephraim <S%H669><s%>, who took <S%H3947><s%> to him a concubine <S%H802><s%> out of Beth <S%H1035><s%>–lehem–judah.

And his concubine <S%H6370><s%> played the whore <S%H2181><s%> against him <S%H3212><s%>, and went away from him unto her father <S%H1><s%>'s house <S%H1004><s%> to Beth <S%H1035><s%>–lehem–judah, and was there four <S%H702><s%> whole months <S%H2320><s%>.

And her husband <S%H376><s%> arose <S%H6965><s%>, and went <S%H3212><s%> after <S%H310><s%> her <S%H1696><s%>, to speak friendly <S%H3820><s%> unto her <S%H7725><s%>, and to bring her again, having his servant <S%H5288><s%> with him <S%H6776><s%>, and a couple of donkeys <S%H2543><s%>: and she brought <S%H935><s%> him into her father <S%H1><s%>'s house <S%H1004><s%>: and when the father <S%H1><s%> of the girl <S%H5291><s%> saw <S%H7200><s%> him <S%H8055><s%>, he rejoiced to meet him <S%H7125><s%>.

And his father in law <S%H2859><s%>, the damsel <S%H5291><s%>'s father <S%H1><s%>, retained <S%H2388><s%> him <S%H3427><s%>; and he lived with him three <S%H7969><s%> days <S%H3117><s%>: so they did eat <S%H398><s%> and drink <S%H8354><s%>, and lodged there <S%H3885><s%>.

And it came to pass on the fourth <S%H7243><s%> day <S%H3117><s%>, when they arose early <S%H7925><s%> in the morning <S%H1242><s%>, that he rose up <S%H6965><s%> to depart <S%H3212><s%>: and the damsel <S%H5291><s%>'s father <S%H1><s%> said <S%H559><s%> unto his son in law <S%H2860><s%>, Comfort <S%H5582><s%> your heart <S%H3820><s%> with a morsel <S%H6595><s%> of bread <S%H3899><s%>, and afterward <S%H310><s%> go your way <S%H3212><s%>.

And they sat down <S%H3427><s%>, and did eat <S%H398><s%> and drink <S%H8354><s%> both <S%H8147><s%> of them together <S%H3162><s%>: for the damsel <S%H5291><s%>'s father <S%H1><s%> had said <S%H559><s%> unto the man <S%H376><s%>, Be content <S%H2974><s%>, I pray you <S%H3885><s%>, and stay all night, and let your heart <S%H3820><s%> be merry <S%H3190><s%>.
And when the man <S%H376><s%> rose up <S%H6965><s%> to depart <S%H3212><s%>, his father in law <S%H2859><s%> urged <S%H6484><s%> him <S%H3885><s%>: therefore he lodged there again <S%H7725><s%>.

And he arose early <S%H7925><s%> in the morning <S%H1242><s%> on the fifth <S%H2549><s%> day <S%H3117><s%> to depart <S%H3212><s%>: and the damsel <S%H5291><s%>'s father <S%H1><s%> said <S%H559><s%>, Comfort <S%H5582><s%> your heart <S%H3824><s%>, I pray you <S%H4102><s%>. And they stayed until afternoon <S%H3117><s%>, and they did eat <S%H398><s%> both of them <S%H8147><s%>.

And when the man <S%H376><s%> rose up <S%H6965><s%> to depart <S%H3212><s%>, he <S%H6370><s%>, and his concubine, and his servant <S%H5288><s%>, his father in law <S%H2859><s%>, the damsel <S%H5291><s%>'s father <S%H1><s%>, said <S%H559><s%> unto him <S%H3117><s%>, Behold, now the day draws <S%H7503><s%> toward evening <S%H6150><s%>, I pray you stay all night <S%H3885><s%>: behold <S%H3117><s%>, the day grows to an end <S%H2583><s%>, lodge <S%H3885><s%> here <S%H3824><s%>, that your heart may be merry <S%H3190><s%>; and to morrow <S%H4279><s%> get you early <S%H7925><s%> on your way <S%H1870><s%>, that you may go <S%H1980><s%> home <S%H168><s%>.

But the man <S%H376><s%> would <S%H14><s%> not stay that night <S%H3885><s%>, but he rose up <S%H6965><s%> and departed <S%H3212><s%>, and came <S%H935><s%> over against <S%H5227><s%> Jebus <S%H2982><s%>, which is Jerusalem <S%H3389><s%>; and there were with him two <S%H6776><s%> donkeys <S%H2543><s%> saddled <S%H2280><s%>, his concubine also was with him <S%H6370><s%>.

And when they were by Jebus <S%H2982><s%>, the day <S%H3117><s%> was far <S%H3966><s%> spent <S%H7286><s%>; and the servant <S%H5288><s%> said <S%H559><s%> unto his master <S%H113><s%>, Come <S%H3212><s%>, I pray you <S%H5493><s%>, and let us turn in into this city <S%H5892><s%> of the Jebusites <S%H2983><s%>, and lodge in it <S%H3885><s%>.

And his master <S%H113><s%> said <S%H559><s%> unto him <S%H5493><s%>, We will not turn aside here into the city <S%H5892><s%> of a stranger <S%H5237><s%>, that is not of the sons <S%H1121><s%> of Israel <S%H3478><s%>; we will pass over <S%H5674><s%> to Gibeah <S%H1390><s%>.

And he said <S%H559><s%> unto his servant <S%H5288><s%>, Come <S%H3212><s%>, and let us draw near <S%H7126><s%> to one <S%H259><s%> of these places <S%H4725><s%> to lodge all night <S%H3885><s%>, in Gibeah <S%H1390><s%>, or in Ramah <S%H7414><s%>.

And they passed on <S%H5674><s%> and went their way <S%H3212><s%>; and the sun <S%H8121><s%> went down <S%H935><s%> upon them when they were by <S%H681><s%> Gibeah <S%H1390><s%>, which belongs to Benjamin <S%H1144><s%>.

And they turned aside <S%H5493><s%> there <S%H935><s%>, to go in and to lodge <S%H3885><s%> in Gibeah <S%H1390><s%>: and when he went in <S%H935><s%>, he sat him down <S%H3427><s%> in a street <S%H7339><s%> of the city <S%H5892><s%>: for there was no man <S%H376><s%> that took <S%H622><s%> them into his house <S%H1004><s%> to lodging <S%H3885><s%>.

And <S%H935><s%>, behold, there came an old <S%H2205><s%> man <S%H376><s%> from his work <S%H4639><s%> out of the field <S%H7704><s%> at even <S%H6153><s%>, which was also <S%H376><s%> of mountain <S%H2022><s%> Ephraim <S%H669><s%>; and he stayed <S%H1481><s%> in Gibeah <S%H1390><s%>: but the men <S%H582><s%> of the place <S%H4725><s%> were Benjamites <S%H1145><s%>.

And when he had lifted up <S%H5375><s%> his eyes <S%H5869><s%>, he saw <S%H7200><s%> a wayfaring <S%H732><s%> man <S%H376><s%> in the street <S%H7339><s%> of the city <S%H5892><s%>: and the old <S%H2205><s%> man <S%H376><s%> said <S%H559><s%>, Where go <S%H3212><s%> you and from where <S%H370><s%> come you <S%H935><s%>

And he said <S%H559><s%> unto him <S%H5674><s%>, We are passing from Beth <S%H1035><s%>–lehem–judah toward the side <S%H3411><s%> of mountain <S%H2022><s%> Ephraim <S%H669><s%>; from there am I <S%H3212><s%>: and I went to Beth <S%H1035><s%>–lehem–judah, but I am now going <S%H1980><s%> to the house <S%H1004><s%> of the Lord <S%H3068><s%>; and there is no man <S%H376><s%> that receives <S%H622><s%> me to house <S%H1004><s%>.

Yet there is <S%H3426><s%> both straw <S%H8401><s%> and food <S%H4554><s%> for our donkeys <S%H2543><s%>; and there is bread <S%H3899><s%> and wine <S%H3196><s%> also for me <S%H519><s%>, and for your handmaid, and for the young man <S%H5288><s%> which is with your servants <S%H5650><s%>: there is no want <S%H4270><s%> of any thing <S%H1697><s%>.

And the old <S%H2205><s%> man <S%H376><s%> said <S%H559><s%>, Peace <S%H7965><s%> be with you <S%H7535><s%>; howsoever let all your wants <S%H4270><s%> lie upon me <S%H3885><s%>; only lodge not in the street <S%H7339><s%>.

So he brought <S%H935><s%> him into his house <S%H1004><s%>, and gave food <S%H1101><s%> unto the donkeys <S%H2543><s%>: and they washed <S%H7364><s%> their feet <S%H7272><s%>, and did eat <S%H398><s%> and drink <S%H8354><s%>.

Now as they were making their hearts <S%H3820><s%> merry <S%H3190><s%>, behold <S%H582><s%>, the men of the city <S%H5892><s%>, certain <S%H582><s%> sons <S%H1121><s%> of Belial <S%H1100><s%>, beset <S%H5437><s%> the house <S%H1004><s%> round about <S%H5437><s%>, and beat <S%H1849><s%> at the door <S%H1817><s%>, and spoke <S%H559><s%> to the master <S%H1167><s%> of the house <S%H1004><s%>, the old <S%H2205><s%> man <S%H376><s%>, saying <S%H559><s%>, Bring forth <S%H3318><s%> the man <S%H376><s%> that came <S%H935><s%> into your house <S%H1004><s%>, that we may know him <S%H3045><s%>.

And the man <S%H376><s%>, the master <S%H1167><s%> of the house <S%H1004><s%>, went out <S%H3318><s%> unto them <S%H559><s%>, and said unto them <S%H408><s%>, No, my brothers <S%H251><s%>, No <S%H7489><s%>, I pray you, do not so wickedly; seeing <S%H310><s%> that this man <S%H376><s%> is come <S%H935><s%> into my house <S%H1004><s%>, do <S%H6213><s%> not this wickedness <S%H5039><s%>.

Behold <S%H1323><s%>, here is my daughter a maiden <S%H1330><s%>, and his concubine <S%H6370><s%>; them I will bring out <S%H3318><s%> now <S%H6031><s%>, and humble you them <S%H6213><s%>, and do with them what seems <S%H5869><s%> good <S%H2896><s%> unto you <S%H376><s%>: but unto this man do <S%H6213><s%> not so <S%H2063><s%> vile <S%H5039><s%> a thing <S%H1697><s%>.

But the men <S%H582><s%> would <S%H14><s%> not listen <S%H8085><s%> to him <S%H376><s%>: so the man took <S%H2388><s%> his concubine <S%H6370><s%>, and brought <S%H3318><s%> her forth <S%H2351><s%> unto them <S%H3045><s%>; and they knew her <S%H5953><s%>, and abused her all the night <S%H3915><s%> until the morning <S%H1242><s%>: and when the day <S%H7837><s%> began to spring <S%H5927><s%>, they let her go <S%H7971><s%>.

Then came <S%H935><s%> the woman <S%H802><s%> in the dawning <S%H6437><s%> of the day <S%H1242><s%>, and fell down <S%H5307><s%> at the door <S%H6607><s%> of the man <S%H376><s%>'s house <S%H1004><s%> where her lord <S%H113><s%> was <S%H216><s%>, until it was light.

And her lord <S%H113><s%> rose up <S%H6965><s%> in the morning <S%H1242><s%>, and opened <S%H6605><s%> the doors <S%H1817><s%> of the house <S%H1004><s%>, and went out <S%H3318><s%> to go <S%H3212><s%> his way <S%H1870><s%>: and <S%H802><s%>, behold, the woman his concubine <S%H6370><s%> was fallen down <S%H5307><s%> at the door <S%H6607><s%> of the house <S%H1004><s%>, and her hands <S%H3027><s%> were upon the threshold <S%H5592><s%>.

And he said <S%H559><s%> unto her <S%H6965><s%>, Up, and let us be going <S%H3212><s%>. But none answered <S%H6030><s%>. Then the man <S%H376><s%> took <S%H3947><s%> her up upon an donkey <S%H2543><s%>, and the man <S%H376><s%> rose up <S%H6965><s%>, and went <S%H3212><s%> him unto his place <S%H4725><s%>.

And when he was come <S%H935><s%> into his house <S%H1004><s%>, he took <S%H3947><s%> a knife <S%H3979><s%>, and laid hold <S%H2388><s%> on his concubine <S%H6370><s%>, and divided <S%H5408><s%> her <S%H6106><s%>, together with her bones, into twelve <S%H8147><s%> pieces <S%H5409><s%>, and sent <S%H7971><s%> her into all the coasts <S%H1366><s%> of Israel <S%H3478><s%>.

And it was so <S%H1961><s%>, that all that saw <S%H7200><s%> it said <S%H559><s%>, There was no such deed <S%H2063><s%> done nor seen <S%H7200><s%> from the day <S%H3117><s%> that the sons <S%H1121><s%> of Israel <S%H3478><s%> came up <S%H5927><s%> out of the land <S%H776><s%> of Egypt <S%H4714><s%> unto this day <S%H3117><s%>: consider <S%H7760><s%> of it <S%H5779><s%>, take advice, and speak your minds <S%H1696><s%>.
